titles: The king and kingdoms joyful day of triumph. Or, The kings most excellent majesties royal and triumphant coming to London, accompanied by the ever renowned, his excellenct the Lord General Monck ... To the tune of, The Scottish lady, or, Ill tide that cruel peace that gain'd a war on me.
author: Wade, John, fl. 1660-1680.
notes: Right half-sheet contains: The second part, to the same tune.
Date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
keywords: Charles --  II, --  King of England, 1630-1685 --  Poetry.
